cookingMethod: Boil spaghetti, saute garlic and pancetta, mix eggs and cheese, combine all ingredients and season with black pepper.
Saute garlic in butter, add shrimp and cook until pink, add lemon juice and parsley, season with salt and black pepper.
Stir fry beef, broccoli, garlic, and ginger, add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and brown sugar, thicken with cornstarch, drizzle with sesame oil.
Marinate chicken in soy sauce and vinegar, brown chicken and garlic, add marinade and simmer with bay leaves, peppercorns, and brown sugar.
Saute garlic, carrots, peas, and corn, scramble eggs, add rice and soy sauce, stir fry until heated through, garnish with green onions.
Boil pasta, saute garlic in olive oil, add sun-dried tomatoes and pasta, toss with pesto and parmesan cheese.
Cut tops off bell peppers, brown beef with onion and garlic, mix with rice and tomato sauce, stuff into peppers, bake at 375F for 40 minutes.
Cook chicken and vegetables in curry paste, add coconut milk and simmer, add fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, and basil leaves.
Season shrimp and saute until cooked, mix cabbage, jalapeno, lime juice, and cilantro for slaw, assemble tacos with slaw, shrimp, sour cream, and hot sauce.
Cook pasta, saute garlic in butter, add chicken and cook, add cream and cheese, toss with pasta.
Press and cube tofu, saute with veggies and garlic/ginger, mix soy sauce/sriracha/cornstarch/sesame oil and pour over stir-fry.
Mix breadcrumbs/parmesan/seasonings in one bowl, whisk eggs in another, dip chicken in egg then breadcrumb mixture, bake until golden brown and crispy.
Cook quinoa, saute onion/mushrooms/spinach/garlic, mix with cooked quinoa and crushed tomatoes, stuff mixture into halved bell peppers, top with parmesan cheese and bake.
Whisk soy sauce/honey/rice vinegar/garlic/ginger/cornstarch in bowl, pan-sear salmon until crispy, add teriyaki sauce and sliced green onions to pan and let sauce thicken.
Saute onion/celery/carrots/garlic, add lentils/tomatoes/spices/broth, simmer until lentils are cooked through, top with chopped cilantro.

Mix honey, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to make a marinade. Coat chicken with marinade and let sit for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375°F. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken until browned on both sides. Transfer to a baking dish and bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through.

Heat olive oil and butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until soft. Add arborio rice and cook until translucent. Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed. Gradually add broth, stirring occasionally, until rice is cooked al dente. Add mushrooms and continue cooking until they are tender. Stir in parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Grill salmon for 5-6 minutes on each side. In a bowl, combine diced mango, red onion, jalapeno pepper, lime juice, and cilantro. Drizzle with olive oil and stir. Serve grilled salmon with mango salsa on top.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch slices. Dip slices into flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Fry eggplant until browned on both sides. Transfer to a baking dish. Pour tomato sauce on top of eggplant. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
